Text:
Amazing Mag Up's Thanks, You are clearly the best on here for File size, the smaller the better.
Thanks mate

Yes, others post pdf magazines in enormous sizes, but mine are aimed solely on users who still use dial-up internet connections, which are extremely slow on bandwidth speed.

The downside of creating smaller pdf's can be a compromise on quality.  Acrobat Distiller in my opinion has its good points, yet the outcome of the converted file doesn't always guarantee a high quality output.   It's a trial and eror thing.

I was DL'ing both large & small size files (just to see) and opening both together using Adobe there was no difference at all!  Infact I smaller size file opens into the window full size, I like the smaller file better, all ready getting a few in epub format soon all will be.
Thanks
